Decoupling isn't just for developers

A while ago I read this article: Complexity and Strategy

I highly recommend reading it. It’s much better than any of my blog posts.

One sentence that still lingers in my mind two months later is this one:

Features interact — intentionally — and that makes the cost of implementing the N+1 feature closer to N than 1.

Your designer produces a beautiful new design for your homepage which they predict will boost conversions. You need conversions. You are losing money. You get a developer onto it straight away.

Tasty

If you use Facebook, you’ve probably noticed the recipe videos from Tasty frequently featuring on your news feed. They’re everywhere right now.

To go viral on Facebook a video needs to catch your attention, without any sound, while you’re scrolling through the news feed. The Tasty videos do that, I stop scrolling every time.

Dec 19, 2015

Rules of the blog

I’ve always struggled with blogging. I want to do it, I have things that I want to share. But it always happens in bursts, a few good posts create a high bar for future posts, which get half written but never published.

Mostly I agonise over what I should be blogging about. Should I post my travel pictures? Should I be posting my own introspections? Or should I be posting my commentary on things?
